page.title: 13 POLLUTION IN ROCK FERRY
page.content: {Pollution}in our area is of several tyes. {The River Mersey}is polluted with oil, petrol and other chemicals from factories and ships. I once saw lumps of fat in the river which came from a margarine factory. There are no fish in the river near us because of this. Another type of{pollution is {caused by lead. We have high levels {of lead dust found in our school yard. Two things could have caused this. One thing could be a by-pass, carrying heavy traffic, built right next to the school. Lead from exhaust fumes is blown into the school. The other thing is that the school was built in 1932 and was once painted with{lead {paint. }Flakes of the old paint could have fallen into the yard. The yard has to be hosed down in dry weather to keep the dust down.
